parallelComputingLib
Class Server

java.lang.Object
  parallelComputingLib.Server
All Implemented Interfaces:
NetworkListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
GeneServer
public abstract class Server
extends java.lang.Object
implements NetworkListener

Title: Server

Description: This class acts like an orchestrator, while not doing any calculations itself it deals out work accordingly. Workers are started up first individually. When the server is started it broadcasts for workers to connect. Server is started last it tells each worker to open up a connection to it and starts transferring data to them. A network callback model was used and is detailed more in NetworkEvent and the NetworkListener class.

The individual method calls work like this. All the following methods are abstract and need to have code provided by you the programmer. First create a class that extends server. Then implement each of the methods as follows:

getWorkerData - This method can be called at any point but it's easiest to call it when a tcp event occurs. This method should return a bytebuffer formatted like your workers will expect.
handleData - This method is called on a read event which is assumed to have worker results. This method should be used to store results, but anything can be done with the data.
identifyTCPDataAcceptEvent - An accept event is assumed to be a new worker asking for a connection and data. And with the callback channel that is provided getWorkerData is called to get data to write back to the worker.
identifyTCPDataReadEvent - A read event is assumed to have worker results contained in it. handleData is called with the data and then getWorkerData is called to send new data back to the worker.
identifyUDPData - This method gets called each time a udp event occurs while the server is listening.



Server port: 6866 receive all advertisements here.

Packet Format ( All id's are the current system time )

Server Advertise Packet
[(byte)'3'| long id ]
[1 byte   | 8 bytes]

Worker Advertise Packet
[(byte)'1' | long id ]
[1 byte    | 8 bytes]

Worker Row Sum Data Packet
[byte Operation | long row |long number of rows |long numbers per row |Data...]
[ 1 byte | 8 bytes | 8 bytes |8 bytes | ...]


Worker Row Sum Result Packet
[byte Operation | long row | double results...]
[ 1 byte | 8 bytes | 8 bytes ]


Worker Component Density Data Packet
[byte Operation | long row |long number of rows |long numbers per row |Data...]
[ 1 byte | 8 bytes | 8 bytes |8 bytes | ...]


Worker Component Density Result Packet
[byte Operation | long row | double results...]
[ 1 byte | 8 bytes | 8 bytes ]


Worker Division Data Packet
[byte Operation | long row |long number of rows |long numbers per row | Data...]
[ 1 byte | 8 bytes | 8 bytes |8 bytes | ...]
Data = [Double denominator |Double numerators ... ]

Worker Division Result Packet
[byte Operation | long row | double results...]
[ 1 byte | 8 bytes | 8 bytes ]

networkEventOccurred

public void networkEventOccurred(NetworkEvent e)
This method is used to process network events. This method is best used to identify which event is taking place and to use another method to handle specific events.

Specified by:
networkEventOccurred in interface NetworkListener
Parameters:
e - NetworkEvent The network event to process.

setupServer

public void setupServer()
This is the first method to call after creating a new Server instance. It setups up listeners and channels.

getWorkerData

protected abstract java.nio.ByteBuffer getWorkerData()
This method is called each time a worker returns a result packet and is ready for new data to be sent. This method needs an implementation to complete the class.

Returns:
ByteBuffer Returns a ByteBuffer to be sent to the worker for processing.

removeWorker

protected void removeWorker(java.lang.String ip)
This method removes a worker from the pool of available workers.

Parameters:
ip - String The ip address of the worker being removed.

identifyTCPDataReadEvent

protected abstract void identifyTCPDataReadEvent(java.nio.ByteBuffer msg,
                                                 int read,
                                                 java.nio.channels.SocketChannel callback)
This method is called when networkEventOccurred has identified data as a TCP read event.
Custom data processing on the server side can be obtained by providing an implementation with your code.
Read events are assumed to be results from workers processing data.

Parameters:
msg - ByteBuffer Incoming data sent from worker.
read - int The read size of the packet.
callback - SocketChannel The SocketChannel to write back to the worker with if needed.

identifyTCPDataAcceptEvent

protected abstract void identifyTCPDataAcceptEvent(java.nio.channels.SocketChannel callback)
This method is called when networkEventOccurred has identified data as a TCP accept event.
Custom data processing on the server side can be obtained by providing an implementation with your code.
Accept events are assumed to be new workers connecting to the server for data to be processed.

Parameters:
callback - SocketChannel The SocketChannel to write back to the worker with if needed.

identifyUDPData

protected abstract void identifyUDPData(java.nio.ByteBuffer msg,
                                        java.lang.String ip)
This method is called when networkEventOccurred has identified data as a UDP event.
UDP data is broadcasted data from workers or server's identifying themselves or making requests.
Custom data processing on the server side can be obtained by providing an implementation with your code.
Since UDP is not guaranteed it is not used for sending any results or worker data.

Parameters:
msg - ByteBuffer The ByteBuffer packet from the worker.
ip - String The ip address of the packet to optionally use to write back with.

checkForDuplicateWorker

protected void checkForDuplicateWorker(ComputerProperties cp)
Workers broadcast their position on the network at a timed interval. To avoid adding the same worker to the pool more than once this method is called when worker identification packets are processed. This method is used in conjunction with stopWorkerAdvertising() to avoid jamming up the network with broadcast packets.

Parameters:
cp - ComputerProperties The ip address and ID of the computer being checked.

handleData

protected abstract void handleData(java.nio.ByteBuffer data)
This method is called each time a result packet is sent back from a worker. The ByteBuffer is pulled apart and all results are stored in the CFS system.
Custom data processing can be obtained by providing an implementation with your code.

Parameters:
data - ByteBuffer The ByteBuffer result packet from the worker.

makeInetString

protected java.lang.String makeInetString(java.lang.String inet)
This method takes and ip address and removes the last 3 digits and attaches 255 for broadcasting.

Parameters:
inet - String The string representation of the current ip address.
Returns:
String Returns the ip address with 255.

sendKillMessage

protected void sendKillMessage()
This method is called when the server is about to shut down to inform all workers that no more data needs processing. After a worker recieves this method it calles System.exit(0) on itself to shutdown.

setupAdvertising

public void setupAdvertising()
This method sets up and starting advertising it's unique id and ip address over the network.

setupStorageFile

public void setupStorageFile()
This method sets up the storage file system. It makes a call to ServerProps.txt in order to find where it's getting data from and where it should be stored.
ServerProps looks like this

StorageFile=Results.txt
DataFile=Data.txt

stopWorkerAdvertising

protected void stopWorkerAdvertising(java.lang.String ip)
When a worker is identified this method is called to help alleivate the network of broadcast conjestion

Parameters:
ip - String The ip address of the worker to stop advertising.

shutdown

public void shutdown()
This is the last method called before exiting and it sends a kill message to all workers to shut down as well as shuts down the file system.
